notes.text: A resource-consumption vulnerability was found in rubygem addressable, where its URI template implementation could allow an attacker's crafted template to consume resources, resulting in a denial of service. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text:
Red Hat CloudForms 5.0 (CFME 5.11) is in the maintenance support phase and we are no longer fixing Moderate/Low severity security bugs. Reference: https://access.redhat.com/support/policy/updates/cloudforms

OpenShift 3.11 components are currently in maintenance support phase, hence Moderate/Low severity security bugs are set as Out Of Support Scope (OOSS). Reference: https://access.redhat.com/support/policy/updates/openshift_noncurrent
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For important instructions on how to upgrade your cluster and fully apply this errata update, see the following documentation, which will be updated shortly for this release:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.8/logging/cluster-logging-release-notes.html

For Red Hat OpenShift Logging 5.2, see the following instructions to apply this update:

https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.8/logging/cluster-logging-upgrading.html
Create template objects only from trusted sources that have been validated not to produce catastrophic backtracking.
